summary_reasoning: Explicitness is moderate: the report lists several core drivers near the valuation (revenue CAGR 15%, average operating margin, WACC 9%, terminal growth 3%), and provides point forecasts for EPS and FCF. Specificity is decent on units and horizon (5-year DCF, 2025–2029 CAGR, percentages), but several inputs lack operational detail (no tax rate, share count/dilution, or working-capital assumptions). Justification is weak-to-partial: revenue CAGR is tied vaguely to “Q1 trends,” margin to a single quarter, and terminal growth to a generic GDP proxy; WACC is only partly decomposed (beta and risk-free rate) without ERP or capital structure. Consistency is poor: there are at least two numeric contradictions—average operating margin stated as 40% in one section versus 41% in the appendix, and forward P/E “15x at fair value” versus “25x P/E” in the same paragraph of implied multiples. Sensitivity/stress-testing is absent: no quantified scenarios for revenue growth, margins, WACC, capex, or terminal growth, and no valuation impact ranges beyond a generic 20–30% uncertainty statement. Given the contradictions and lack of sensitivities on material drivers, the assumptions quality merits a Poor grade per the decision rules.

assumptions_extracted.quote: We project revenue CAGR of 15% from 2025 to 2029
Operating margins are expected to average 40%
We apply a WACC of 9%, reflecting Meta's beta of 1.2 and cost of equity.
full-year 2025 guidance at $64 billion to $72 billion
Starting from 2024 EPS (insufficient data; assuming $18 ...), we forecast 2025 EPS at $22 ... By 2029, EPS reaches $40
implying a forward P/E of 15x at fair value. Implied multiples include 10x EV/sales and 25x P/E

contradictions.description: Average operating margin stated as 40% vs 41% in Appendix
Forward P/E said to be 15x at fair value vs 25x in implied multiples
locations: Fair Value and Profit Drivers (same paragraph)

missing_or_opaque_assumptions: DCF bridge from operating metrics to FCF
unjustified_parameters: Revenue CAGR 15% justified only by 'Q1 trends'
Avg Op Margin (40–41%) anchored to a single quarter
WACC 9% without full ERP/debt structure support
Terminal growth 3% as generic GDP proxy
